intro: Mammillaria haageana subsp. acultzingensis, commonly known as the Acultzingensis mammillaria, is a small, slow-growing cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its globular shape and dense, white to pale green spines. The plant typically features 10–15 radial spines and has a compact, rounded stem that remains relatively short throughout its life. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it well-suited for arid environments. This subspecies is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in succulent collections.
